subject: Programming
title: Clock Speed and Hertz
description: A short lesson to help you apply Clock Speed and Hertz.

hook.text: A 3 GHz processor ticks three billion times per second. Each tick is one chance to do work.

buildup.text: Clock speed sets the rhythm. Faster clocks mean more instructions completed per second.

discovery.text: Hertz measures ticks per second. One gigahertz equals one billion ticks.

twist.text: After 2005, clock speeds stopped climbing. Chips got too hot. More speed meant melting silicon.

climax.text: Engineers switched to adding more cores instead. Two slower cores outperform one fast one.

punchline.text: Speed hit a wall. Parallelism became the detour.

quiz.question: Why did CPU clock speeds stop increasing around 2005?
